results.title: China: coming of the west
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Institute in America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Chinese History”.
Highlights the confrontation between the ideas and scientific knowledge of modern western civilization and ancient Chinese civilization from the 15th to 20th century. Provides historical background to the early influence of the Jesuit missionaries in feudal China, the 19th century trade treaties of industrial societies such as Britain and America. Colonisation by Japan and Russia in early 20th century is also discussed. Includes archival film including the establishment of the Republic of China in 1912.

results.title: Deng's legacy: China as an economic force
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
China’s emergence as a global economic force and dramatic changes within Chinese life are due largely to the policies instituted under Deng Xiaoping. This program examines Deng’s career and the continuing impact of his economic policies. The old style of communism, with its policy of isolation from the West and self-sufficiency, is evolving into a socialist market economy. Joint ventures and foreign investment are becoming popular. The program profiles several such projects and also looks at “special economic zones” such as Hainan which have greater autonomy from the central government. Also looks at some of the problems emerging as a result of rapid change and economic growth, such as prostitution, rural poverty, untempered greed and corruption. Narrated by Joan Chen.

results.title: The Heart of the matter: the decline of traditional cultural values
results.creator_credit: Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Illustrates how changing values and economic pressures are influencing popular culture and traditional values. Profiles a young salesmanager in women’s fashion, who is estranged from her family and communist values and compares a female rock singer with a former star of the Peking Opera. The second part of the program looks at some of the pressures on rural families resulting from the new materialism and rapid economic growth. A range of people voice their concerns about the decline of traditions and the danger of losing the soul of China in the rush for economic and social change.

results.title: The Fragile rice bowl: workers in New China
results.creator_credit: Richard Alexander, Brenda Louie and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
In Communist China, a worker had a guiding concept in life. It was known as the “iron rice bowl” or the notion that one would always be fed. In a brave new China, this concept has been shattered. Profiles Jessica - from her now abandoned job at the state-run factory to the new world of selling cosmetics. Shows the impact of her decision on her own life and the life of her family.

results.title: The Future of Hong Kong: China's gateway to the international community
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Examines what may lie ahead for China and Hong Kong and how it will interact with the international cultural and economic community. For some it is a celebration, for others it is a move to be questioned.

results.title: Communist triumph and consolidation, 1945-1971
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Ken Rosen and Metromedia Producers Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “China: A Century of Revolution”.
Shows how, in four years after Japan’s defeat, the Communists chased the Nationalists off the mainland and established a People’s Republic in Peking. Discusses how the Communists brought a semblance of order to China, despite hostility from Western powers. The other parts of this 3-part series are Part I Agonies of nationalism, 1800-1927 and Part II Enemies within and without, 1927-1944. Narrated by Joseph Campanella.

results.title: Enemies within and without: 1927-1944. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “China: A Century of Revolution”.
Highlights the complex interrelationship of problems in China, including the invasion of Manchuria by Japan and the challenge to the Nationalists by the Communist followers of Mao Tse-tung. Narrated by Jospeh Campanella.

results.title: Agonies of nationalism: 1800 - 1927
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “China: A Century of Revolution”.
Documents invasion by foreign troops, the disappearance of the Manchu Dynasty, eruption of the civil war, rise of the warlords, influence of Sun Yat-sen, Chiang Kai-shek, and the threat of the communists.
